posts.caption: devblog.avdi.org
posts.description: If you're a Ruby programmer, you've almost certainly used Rake, the build utility created by the late Jim Weirich. But you might not realize just how powerful and flexible a tool it can be. I certainly didn't, until I decided to use it as the basis for Quarto, my e-book production toolchain.

posts.description: Often I want to inspect an element (e.g. tooltip) that only appears when another element is hovered. The element that appears is triggered via jquery .mouseenter() event, so it's not shown & h...
